title: Best mid/jungle champions to carry in bronze once you know how to play them well?
body: what are the best mid/jungle champions to carry out of bronze once u play them well

replies.body:
Malzahar! 

He's pretty simple (farm all day with that E), and you can build RoA and be pretty safe. Plus, his ult is awesome because it's like a big giant purple line telling your team to kill that one guy. Great for coordination :D
yea his winrate in low elo is always so high,can hard carry with him all the time :D

Mostly you want to go for hard carry champions like {{champion:55}}  that can dismantle teams if she gets ahead but of course any champ that you learn to play well works, I managed to carry myself out of bronze with {{champion:121}}

Sounds like you need a hypercarry. I have one for each lane.

{{champion:11}} jungle but people ban him 90% in Bronze LOL.

{{champion:55}} mid but people ban her 90% in Bronze LOL.


But for champs who don't always get banned in Bronze, {{champion:157}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:63}} mid and {{champion:254}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:77}} jungle.
I mean how far down in bronze are you ... I went from b5 to b3 80lp before full ad panth stopped working anything snow bally is good
I got to Bronze 3 and was on a big winning streak. Now I've just been slowly losing my rank.. Ill go on a 2 game W streak then lose 3 or 4 in a row. My mindset is just shit

For mid J4 talon and swain are super good when fed and j4 and swain are flex champs you can take top. For jungle Yii is good but I would have someone better than me or you talk you through the proper way to team fight with him so your not just really on you enemies incompetence with cc to win. Cho is decent mid and great top and easy to farm with and you dont have to worry about his e pushing lane if you just bounce it every wave and never get closer than your q range to your opponent you will be pretty safe. I max q to one shot the back line so i can bounce consistently. If they try to hold the minions out tower range you q them and they keep taking all that minion dmg while knocked up and then slowed you've won lane. If your ahead rush rhylais and theres no escape. W and they can only walk 60% speed to try and avoid your q and then with your e you esentially have frozen mallet. Cho's level 6 all in is strong. When you get ganked just run and then when they go to chase there is an obvious best path for the to follow so you can q where they are running and if they keep going theyve been hit if they swerve you've gained ground you have to stay calm though because a bad q means death. My standard full build against balanced dmg and if im not stupid snowballed is rhylais cdr boots frozen heart abyssal scepter gaurdian angel and deathcap. You have solid dmg great cc full cdr with 5% from masteries and your and you are just shy of being a legit tank. 

General tips: If you can bounce the wave and your not behind your lane opponet its not dangerous to shove out the wave and let it get some turret dmg its you following the wave up for harass plus more tower dmg thats a hazard to your kda. Work on your farming thats where you get most of your gold from if you play properly.
Pressure: If you've killed your lane opponent and have 60% hp or 40% and an ally with you go kill the turret. If your lane opponent has backed your healthy and the tower is below 30% take it. Once you've killed it come to lane often enough to keep it past there side of river but don't go past it yourself instead go roam and help your team.

If your computer freezes up in team fights you might want a knew one. If your internet can't handle multiple people( F U Timewarner cable and your adds that your the ultimate internet for gamers if there was another isp here i would get it) don't play ranked when other people are on the internet.

>
>  **once u play them well**

That's all that really matters; learn a champion well (not just mechanically, but strategically), practice your fundamentals, and you can carry with anything

It's easier to do this on with mechanically simple champions; yes you can carry with Azir, but it's difficult since you're wrestling with his mechanics as well as learning the game's fundamentals. Stick to a simple champion you like and work your way up
Anyone that's good at roaming. Kill your lane opponent/jungle creeps, then go win your other lanes.

I checked out your stats for you. The best thing you can do is find a champion that you play well in bronze. You are in bronze 5, so you just need to find a champion that you really enjoy playing and dedicate a lot of time to them. Get very good at your champion. It doesn't matter much which champion you use to carry you out of low bronze. Good ones would be bursty champs you can make plays on. Most assassins are very good at solo carrying in low bronze. Even adcs can if your positioning is good. 

If you want me to watch games of yours and give tips, I can. I'm pretty bored atm, and it's something I like to do. GL.
Jungle, Easily Lee Sin. Mid champions, Zed + brand. Once you get rylais on brand his team can kite and chase forever.
